speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: SCENE IV. Forres. The palace.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Flourish. Enter DUNCAN, MALCOLM, DONALBAIN, LENNOX, and Attendants

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Is execution done on Cawdor? Are not

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Those in commission yet return'd?

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: My liege,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: They are not yet come back. But I have spoke

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: With one that saw him die: who did report

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That very frankly he confess'd his treasons,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Implored your highness' pardon and set forth

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: A deep repentance: nothing in his life

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Became him like the leaving it; he died

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: As one that had been studied in his death

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To throw away the dearest thing he owed,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: As 'twere a careless trifle.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: There's no art

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: To find the mind's construction in the face:

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: He was a gentleman on whom I built

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: An absolute trust.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Enter MACBETH, BANQUO, ROSS, and ANGUS

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: O worthiest cousin!

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: The sin of my ingratitude even now

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Was heavy on me: thou art so far before

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: That swiftest wing of recompense is slow

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: To overtake thee. Would thou hadst less deserved,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: That the proportion both of thanks and payment

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Might have been mine! only I have left to say,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: More is thy due than more than all can pay.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The service and the loyalty I owe,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In doing it, pays itself. Your highness' part

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is to receive our duties; and our duties

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Are to your throne and state children and servants,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which do but what they should, by doing every thing

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Safe toward your love and honour.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Welcome hither:

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: I have begun to plant thee, and will labour

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: To make thee full of growing. Noble Banquo,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: That hast no less deserved, nor must be known

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: No less to have done so, let me enfold thee

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And hold thee to my heart.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: There if I grow,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: The harvest is your own.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: My plenteous joys,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Wanton in fulness, seek to hide themselves

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: In drops of sorrow. Sons, kinsmen, thanes,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And you whose places are the nearest, know

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: We will establish our estate upon

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Our eldest, Malcolm, whom we name hereafter

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: The Prince of Cumberland; which honour must

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Not unaccompanied invest him only,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: But signs of nobleness, like stars, shall shine

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: On all deservers. From hence to Inverness,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And bind us further to you.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The rest is labour, which is not used for you:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I'll be myself the harbinger and make joyful

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The hearing of my wife with your approach;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So humbly take my leave.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: My worthy Cawdor!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: [Aside]  The Prince of Cumberland! that is a step

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: On which I must fall down, or else o'erleap,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For in my way it lies. Stars, hide your fires;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Let not light see my black and deep desires:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The eye wink at the hand; yet let that be,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which the eye fears, when it is done, to see.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: True, worthy Banquo; he is full so valiant,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: And in his commendations I am fed;

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: It is a banquet to me. Let's after him,

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Whose care is gone before to bid us welcome:

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: It is a peerless kinsman.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
